---
title: "infisical-branch-env.json"
---

## High-level description
This JSON file represents a configuration for mapping Git branches to environments in the Infisical CLI. It defines the workspace ID, default environment, and a specific mapping between a Git branch and an environment.

## Symbols

### JSON Structure
#### Description
The JSON structure defines the configuration for branch-to-environment mapping in Infisical.

#### Internal Logic
The file contains three main elements:
1. `workspaceId`: Identifies the workspace in Infisical.
2. `defaultEnvironment`: Specifies the default environment to use.
3. `gitBranchToEnvironmentMapping`: Maps Git branches to specific environments.

### `workspaceId`
#### Description
A string that uniquely identifies the workspace in Infisical.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| workspaceId | string | The unique identifier for the workspace |

### `defaultEnvironment`
#### Description
Specifies the default environment to use when no specific mapping is found.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| defaultEnvironment | string | The name of the default environment |

### `gitBranchToEnvironmentMapping`
#### Description
An object that maps Git branch names to specific environment names.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| gitBranchToEnvironmentMapping | object | Key-value pairs of branch names to environment names |

#### Internal Logic
In this example, there is one mapping:
- The "main" branch is mapped to the "myMainEnv" environment.

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| workspaceId | string | "12345678" | The unique identifier for the workspace |
| defaultEnvironment | string | "myDefaultEnv" | The default environment to use |
| gitBranchToEnvironmentMapping | object | { "main": "myMainEnv" } | Mapping of Git branches to environments |

This configuration file is likely used by the Infisical CLI to determine which environment to use based on the current Git branch. If the current branch is "main", it will use the "myMainEnv" environment. For any other branch, it will fall back to the default environment "myDefaultEnv".
